text: Hi Niki! Thank you so much for your lovely and encouraging message. I do appreciate it. :)
And I hope that my reply finds you well. I am deeply sorry that I could not get back to you sooner. :/
I want to first start out by congratulating you! Hip Hip Hooorrraayyyyy!!!! I wish you many new experiences and joy at your new position!!! :) Fingers crossed!

Weekend, or not, whenever you may have time for me, I will be delighted to have your feedback. But yes, in general, having a game plan, so to speak, works better for me. With hints of flexibility. Hahahaha! Therefore, I am totally comfy with you answering during the weekends. And thank you for your understanding if I may not reply you right away.s

OK. Here goes nothing! :) (I will try to keep the introduction about me as short and organised as possible. To not frighten you! Hahaha! Please, do feel free to ask me any questions when you want to find out more about me.) As you may already noticed from my name, I am an international student. I am from Istanbul, Turkey. But the past couple of years I have been living in Germany.

During my high school education, I had the luck to have my education mostly in English. And afterwards, I have continued to use English as my primary foreign language. After moving out to Germany, I have learned German from scratch. Therefore, I may struggle from time to time to juggle all languages (don't forget my mother language, Turkish, too!). Please, do correct my English if you see any errors? Thank you!

During the time that I was preparing myself for university applications, there was not much going on about Animation education in Istanbul. Therefore I have chosen the best second one. Film Studies. Therefore my background is actually in Film and Video. I have my BA and MA from Film Studies at Istanbul University. From day one, I have started to collect experience and afterwards work at the university but also in the industry.

Our university had two studios for students to practise. After trying my hand in being camerawoman, assistant director, script writer and such, I have settled on being a video editor. Whenever someone asks me my occupation, my answer is video editor. I have also became a part of the tech team at the studios for nearly 6 years. I have helped out dozens and dozens of student short film projects. I have also experience in music videos and advertisement in the industry.

Although my education and my experience served me well, Animation was always there for me. Always a burning flame inside me. Throughout the years, I tried my best to be part of few film and animation festivals. And every time I watched a short animated film or a long one, I felt drawn to it. Not just as an audience. But also the longing to be a name in the credits was there.

Unfortunately, after my MA, I have to take a long break due to health reasons. Longer than I have expected. And since the last one year or so now, I am trying to get back on my feet. Meanwhile I thought, whether this could be a chance for me to at least try and see if Animation could be a path for me, or not.

I was looking at all possible Animation education out there and last year, I came across a 3 week summer course at AUB. I have decided to take a chance on me. To see, whether my gut feeling is right or wrong. During the intense 3 week course, I have done my first Bouncing Ball. :) It was a blast! I have experimented with many things, also with Stop-Mo. And I have realised more and more that I belong to this industry. This world!

The tutors were all very kind and supportive of me although I have different background and plus I am a 'mature' student! :) I am not a 13 year old with a lots and lots of sketchbooks!!! :( I have an education and skills gap. And ongoing health problems. But they all encouraged me to apply for MA. And here I am! I still CAN NOT believe it!!!!!!!!!

One of the reasons why I try to get involved with BA schedule and BA students is that I try to minimise the education and skills gap as much as possible. And also experimenting as much as possible, so that at the end, I may pin down where my interest the most lies. But, to be honest, I STILL can not decide where my heart is!!! 2D or Stop-Mo?!? This is one of the points that I will be needing 'mentoring'.

Also, right now, I am at a crossroads in my MA work. It is a VERY hard time for me. I will be giving my first presentation just under 5 weeks and my first hand-out in 6 weeks. :( And I still have no concrete plan but just all over the place thoughts and ideas!!! :( This is another point that I gladly welcome any help with right now.
I am doing my MA part-time. Therefore I will be still at the university next year. BUT, I am also starting to think about internships for this summer. And I am freaking out!
Or in general, portfolio! Whether to apply for an internship or a part-time/full-time work, I am just so scared right now!!!
And I can not shake the feeling that I am in a huge disadvantage due to my age and gap. (Although, 'till now, all the feedback that I have was on the opposite side.)

I KNOW what I am NOT interested in; I was never interested in CGI/3D. Do not get me wrong, whoever does it, brilliant! I have greatest respect. It is just not for me. It is NOT me. I am not interested in Character Design. Due to my lack of drawing/sketching skills, or the gap of it. I find Background and Layout Design very interesting but for the same reason I do not see them approachable career paths for me.

I am very interested in animation itself. Whether it is 2D or Stop-Mo. But 'till now, I did not get a chance to fully experiment in them. Whether it clean-up or such. I have tried my hand recently in Prop and Set Design for the BA 3rd year Stop-Mo project of ours. And I LOVED it! :)

While attending talks and workshops at the festivals, I have attended a Storyboarding workshop. And I have realised, due to my background in Film, Storyboarding may be a path for me! Therefore I am also very excited to experiment with Storyboarding.
And of course, again, due to my background, editing in Animation is also in the frame. And right now, I am experimenting with it while helping out another 2D 3rd year project of ours as the editor.
I LOVE to observe the 3rd year projects. I see every one of them as my feature colleagues and I am very proud! I love to exchange ideas, discuss, brainstorm.
I am the happiest whenever someone asks my opinion and if I may be any help to them.
I LOVE learning. Although I have my 'MA' title, I see myself pretty equal with all the BA students, in terms of learning and experience. :)
The way how my brain is wired makes me automatically sensitive to little details.
I have no problem with hearing out constructive criticism. As long as they are constructive. :)

And everything just boils down to me at one word; Belonging. I want to belong this industry. Animation is team-work, it is supportive, it is less drama and ego. I want to find a place and my pack where I can be supported and where I can support them. Where we can all learn and grow. In the longer run and in the bigger picture, those are my goals, so to speak. :)
OK. I think I wrote enough!!! Sorry for writing for so long!
If you need any further information, just ask. :)
Thank you very much and I wish a great weekend!!!! Cheers!
